item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 1, 2024 at 3:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Building LLMs from the Ground Up: A 3-Hour Coding Workshop (306 points | 8 comments)
2. Harder Drive: hard drives we didn't want, or need [video] (2022) (286 points | 49 comments)
3. WatchYourLAN: Lightweight Network IP Scanner (98 points | 8 comments)
4. Did your car witness a crime? (181 points | 391 comments)
5. LLMs struggle to explain themselves (23 points | 25 comments)
6. Making an atomic trampoline [video] (41 points | 13 comments)
7. AirTags key to discovery of Houston's plastic recycling deception (80 points | 52 comments)
8. A brief history of barbed wire fence telephone networks (35 points | 4 comments)
9. The thrill of AI is fading – and Wall Street is getting clear-eyed about value (21 points | 14 comments)
10. MapRoulette: the micro-tasking tool for OpenStreetMap (9 points | discuss)
11. Percona Everest: open-source automated database provisioning and management (39 points | 5 comments)
12. Astronomers puzzled by little red galaxies that seem impossibly dense (31 points | 16 comments)
13. Client-side QR code generator with SVG output (60 points | 8 comments)
14. Neutral beam microscopy using magnetic beam spin encoding (16 points | discuss)
15. Non-Determinism and Overcount on Modern Hardware Performance Counters [pdf] (6 points | discuss)
16. Oprah will screw up the AI story (23 points | 12 comments)
17. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
18. Show HN: A retro terminal text editor for GNU/Linux coded in C (C-edit) (128 points | 34 comments)
19. Brazil's X ban is sending lots of people to Bluesky (121 points | 215 comments)
20. Lucee: A light-weight dynamic CFML scripting language for the JVM (60 points | 22 comments)
21. Show HN: Typeform alternative, turns Markdown to forms (125 points | 37 comments)
22. Palmer Luckey, American Vulcan (9 points | discuss)
23. Solving the labyrinth puzzle from the university quest using Python (3 points | discuss)
24. My fake job in Y2K preparedness (106 points | 71 comments)
25. Is my vision that bad? No, it's just a bug in Apple's Calculator (558 points | 354 comments)
26. Buy, Borrow, Die – Explained (332 points | 262 comments)
27. The Threat to OpenAI (102 points | 106 comments)
28. Bresenham's Circle Drawing Algorithm (2021) (100 points | 36 comments)
29. The Great Vic Gravel Route: Crossing Victoria on Unsealed Roads (2022) (61 points | 28 comments)
30. Iron as an inexpensive storage medium for hydrogen (141 points | 82 comments)
